details.description: The case report does not mention testing for Hepatitis E Virus (HEV), Cytomegalovirus (CMV), Epstein-Barr Virus (EBV), or Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV), which are potential, albeit less common, causes of acute hepatitis.

A liver biopsy was not performed. Histological examination could have provided definitive evidence for drug-induced liver injury and conclusively ruled out other conditions like autoimmune hepatitis or other underlying liver diseases.
Specific data on the rate of decline for alkaline phosphatase (ALP) and total bilirubin are not provided in the case report.
